arm_group.description: Eligible for regular chemotherapy, elects and receives regular chemotherapy
Eligible for regular chemotherapy, elects and receives low-dose chemotherapy
Eligible for regular chemotherapy, elects and receives palliative care only
Ineligible for regular chemotherapy, elects and receives low-dose chemotherapy
Ineligible for regular chemotherapy, elects and receives palliative care only

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients diagnosed with Stage IV cancer (solid tumors only) are evaluated to determine
      whether they are candidates for traditional chemotherapy.  If eligible, patients are offered
      traditional chemotherapy, low-dose chemotherapy, or palliative care.  If ineligible,
      patients are offered low-dose chemotherapy or palliative care.  Patients will be monitored
      for 5 years and survival data recorded.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of Survival Outcomes of Stage IV Cancer Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Presenting with Stage IV cancer (solid tumors only)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient declines inclusion

clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study of Survival Times of Stage IV Cancer Patients

oversight_info.authority: China: Institutional Review Board, Yang Ling Demonstration Zone Hospital

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
